Question:
Find the average of the following sets of numbers.
693, 456, 876, 532, 934, 691, 596, 398, 682
The largest three-digit number that gives the same remainder 2 when divided by 3, 5 and 9 is __________
A person can hit a target 5 times out of 8 shots. If he fires 10 shots, what is the probability that he will hit the target twice?

The angle of elevation of the top of a tower from the top of a building whose height is 680 m is 45° and the angle of elevation of the top of same tower from the foot of the same building is 60°. What is the height (in m) of the tower?
The median of a set of 11 distinct observations is 73.2. If each of the largest five observations of the set is increased by 3, then the median of the new set:
OP1: is 3 times that of the original set
OP3: remains the same as that of the original set

Question: In a trapezium ABCD, AD and BC are parallel to each other with a perpendicular distance of 8 m between them. Also, \((AB) = (CD) = 10\) m, and \((AD) = 15\) m, \((AD) < (BC)\). What is the perimeter (in m) of the trapezium ABCD?
A prism and a pyramid have the same base and the same height. Find the ratio of the volumes of the prism and the pyramid.
If \(x = \sqrt{64} + \sqrt{121} - \sqrt{169}\), then find the value of \(x^2\).
If two LED TVs and one mobile phone cost ₹31,000, while two mobile phones and one LED TV cost ₹35,000, then the value of one mobile phone is:
What is the volume of a cylinder if the radius of the cylinder is 10 cm and height is 20 cm? (Take \(\pi = 3.14\))

P, Q, and R can finish a work in 5 days, 10 days, and 15 days, respectively, working alone. P and Q work on the first day, P and R work on the second day and P and Q work on the third day, and so on till the work is completed. In how many days the work will be completed?
A goods train 350 m long passes through a tunnel of length 1250 m in 80 seconds. What is the speed of the train?
If one of the interior angles of a regular polygon is \(\frac{15}{16}\) times of one of the interior angles of a regular decagon, then find the number of diagonals of the polygon.
If the four-digit number 463y is divisible by 7, then what is the value of y?
If \(a \cot \theta + b \csc \theta = p\) and \(b \cot \theta + a \csc \theta = q\) then \(p^2 - q^2\) is equal to __________
PQRS is a cyclic quadrilateral. If \(\angle P\) is three times of \(\angle R\) and \(\angle S\) is four times of \(\angle Q\), then the sum of \(\angle S + \angle R\) will be:
Working for 10 hours per day, 6 men can build a wall in a certain number of days. By working for how many hours per day can 12 men build the wall in the same days?

What is the mode of the given data?
5, 7, 9, 7, 3, 7, 5, 7, 8, 6, 7
Which of the following numbers is divisible by 11?
It is given that \(\triangle ABC \cong \triangle PQR\), AB = 5 cm, \(\angle B = 40^{\circ}\), and \(\angle A = 80^{\circ}\). Which of the following options is true?
How many kilogram of rice costing Rs. 60 per kg must be mixed with 24 kg of rice costing Rs. 42 per kg so that there may be a gain of 12% by selling the mixture at Rs. 56 per kg?
At a clearance sale, a shopkeeper gives 45% discount. If a customer paid ₹330 during the sale, then what is the marked price of that shirt?
If 20% of (A + B) = 30% of (A - B), then what percentage of B is equal to A?
Find the coordinates of the points where the graph 57x - 19y = 399 cuts the coordinate axes.

Rajnish borrowed ₹1,500 from a bank and repaid the entire amount with interest in two equal annual instalments, the first instalment being paid a year after Rajnish borrowed from the bank. If the rate of interest was 40% per annum, compounded annually, then what was the value (in ₹) of each instalment paid by Rajnish?
A sum triple itself in 9 years at simple interest. Find the rate of interest per annum is.
A starts a business with ₹75,000 and B joins the business 5 months later with an investment of ₹80,000. After 1 year, they earn a profit of ₹4,08,800. Find the share of A and B (in ₹).
\((\sin \theta + \csc \theta)^2 + (\cos \theta + \sec \theta)^2 = ?\)
The value of \(\frac{0.7 \times 0.7 \times 0.7 + 0.3 \times 0.3 \times 0.3}{0.7 \times 0.7 - 0.7 \times 0.3 + 0.3 \times 0.3}\) is
